name: TouchList
description: The TouchList interface represents a list of contact points with a touch surface; for example, if the user has three fingers on the touch surface (such as a screen or trackpad), the corresponding TouchList object would have one Touch object for each finger, for a total of three entries.

members.name: TouchList.length
members.description: The number of Touch objects in the TouchList.

parameters.name: numTouches
parameters.description: The number of touch points in touchList.

members.name: TouchList.identifiedTouch()
members.description: Returns the first Touch item in the list whose identifier matches a specified value.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An integer value identifying the Touch object to retrieve from the list.

parameters.name: touchItem
parameters.description: A Touch object matching the specified id.

members.name: TouchList.item()
members.description: Returns the Touch object at the specified index in the list.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the Touch object to retrieve. The index is a number in the range of 0 to one less than the length of the TouchList.

parameters.name: touchPoint
parameters.description: The requested Touch object from the TouchList. Returns null if the index is not less than the length of the list.
